column1: This holiday weekend let’s again say THANK YOU to the doctors nurses health care professionals supermarket employees postal workers delivery truck drivers and all others on the front lines of #COVID19. We are thankful for all you do each and every day.

The latest COVID vaccine news is excellent.  There is a light at the end of the tunnel.  Let’s work together and follow the COVID safety steps.   We won’t need to do this forever.   But we need to do it for a while longer.

Mitch McConnell and our Republican colleagues must acknowledge the need for bold action on the COVID crisis and come to the table to work on meaningful relief.   Their denial delays and distractions only further divide our country.
It’s time for @senatemajldr Mitch McConnell to get to business on the transition of power and working with us on a bipartisan legislative agenda starting with COVID-19. There’s no time to waste.
We must focus our attention on crushing COVID and healing our nation while rejecting the spread of disinformation distrust and division. We’re all in this together.

Counting down the days to #ElectionDay here are some things I’m proud of from our first term in Congress:  #2  Being accountable to our constituents and holding scores of town halls and house parties both in person and virtually since the beginning of COVID-19. Thank you #CA49! https://t.co/atOhaMXj08

Counting down the days to #ElectionDay here are some things I’m proud of from our first term in Congress:  #8  Standing up for Community Health Centers in our district  to ensure they have received their fair share of relief funding during COVID-19. https://t.co/Mw6ZHgwvWU
Tune in Live: Rep. Mike Levin Virtual Town Hall on the #Coronavirus. https://t.co/uM8S6L1CqL

Counting down the days to #ElectionDay here are some things I’m proud of from our first term in Congress:  #10   Delivering Paycheck Protection Program loans to help over 20000 small businesses in our district get through the COVID-19 crisis. https://t.co/6tO4W7kqSB

Counting down the days to #ElectionDay here are some things I’m proud of from our first term in Congress:  #11   Bringing more than $75 million in federal relief to help health care providers in our district cover costs incurred as a result of COVID-19. https://t.co/oEnGd3pplm

Over 125000 Americans have lost their lives to #COVID19 in the five months since we passed the Heroes Act.  During that time @senatemajldr McConnell has refused to negotiate and failed our nation in a time of crisis. He is indeed laughing at all of us. https://t.co/wFuSKrUUWg
Tune in Live: Rep. Mike Levin Virtual Town Hall on the #Coronavirus. https://t.co/wJIIMRzrNe

We were closer to a #COVID19 deal than we had been in a long time. Many of my colleagues on both sides of the aisle have been eager to get more relief to the American people soon. Then President Trump unilaterally quit negotiating altogether. (1/2)

We all want to see a safe and effective vaccine for #COVID19 with a release driven by scientific rather than political considerations. FDA must stay in the lead. Distribution must be equitable. This must not be driven by an Election Day timetable. https://t.co/aC89ZiH6Dj

Counting down the days to #ElectionDay here are some things I’m proud of from our first term in Congress:   #28   Having the President sign our bipartisan bill to provide additional legal protections for servicemembers impacted by COVID-19. (1/2) https://t.co/fkPrHyhGox

Honored to be on NBC San Diego this morning to talk about the need for additional #COVID19 support and our bipartisan work for veterans and the environment. Thank you #CA49! @nbcsandiego https://t.co/bh3CKCYPN5

Counting down the days to #ElectionDay here are some things I’m proud of from our first term in Congress:  #37   Fighting veteran homelessness during COVID-19 by passing bipartisan legislation to allow VA to use existing funds for more services to help. https://t.co/BRGXVn1sxQ
Tune in Live: Rep. Mike Levin Virtual Town Hall on the #Coronavirus. https://t.co/ITq2w8zsmv

Counting down the days to #ElectionDay  here are some things I’m proud of from our first term in Congress:  #42  Demanding transparency from FEMA regarding distribution of PPE supplies during COVID-19. https://t.co/OSuecCsTwk

200000 Americans tragically dead from #COVID19.  So much more than a statistic.  These are mothers and fathers brothers and sisters sons and daughters loved ones and friends.  It didn’t have to be this bad. We must take action to prevent the further unnecessary loss of life.

Counting down the days to #ElectionDay here are some things I’m proud of from our first term in Congress:  #43  Fighting for emergency sick leave for our workers during the COVID-19 crisis. https://t.co/HlRjbpYzX7

Thanks to @BAPACSD for hosting a Candidate Forum today to discuss the critical issues in San Diego County and across America including the disproportionate impact COVID-19 has had on communities of color. Excellent job! https://t.co/2N60WwxaK2
Tune in Live: Rep. Mike Levin Virtual Town Hall on the #Coronavirus. https://t.co/70ip9mGo7z

Please join me live SATURDAY September 12 at 3:30 PM Pacific for our latest Virtual Town Hall. We’ll be covering the latest on #COVID19 and much more. This will be our 41st Virtual Town Hall since March!  Please send questions to TownHallQuestions@mikelevin.org.  Thanks #CA49! https://t.co/FWsHGWTDcg

This op-ed from April takes on new significance knowing that Trump intentionally downplayed COVID-19 throughout February and March. Many lives and livelihoods could have been saved had Trump acted just two weeks sooner at the beginning of March. https://t.co/SSvmU5gxbs

The House passed its COVID relief bill in the middle of May.   Mitch McConnell took a three month pause. His new proposal is incredibly weak.  We remain committed to working with the Senate and Administration on legislation to actually meet the health and economic crises we face.

This #LaborDay let’s recommit to support those who lost their jobs and those still on the frontlines during the #COVID19 crisis.  From those delivering mail at the @USPS to our grocery store and food service employees to our health care workers and more — we appreciate you!

This #LaborDayWeekend we recognize the hard-fought achievements of American workers and the labor movement — especially the contributions of so many during the COVID-19 pandemic.   I hope you all stay safe and healthy this weekend. The virus isn’t taking a holiday. 🇺🇸 😷 https://t.co/dhqjdXH91a

The COVID crisis continues to hit state and local government hard — including potentially devastating cuts to education. The #HeroesAct provides state and local relief to preserve funding for students and schools among others. We must put #FamiliesFirst! https://t.co/0tPG9PXver

Trump’s apparent strategy is to pin all his failures on Joe Biden.   Let’s state the obvious here: Trump is President not Biden.  Trump has failed us on COVID-19 and in so many other ways and done nothing but fan the flames of division and fear.  Trump has failed us. Period.

The failure to eliminate cost barriers for preventative care and treatment for COVID is inexcusable. It’s also more evidence of the dysfunctional incompetent response of the Trump Administration to the crisis that continues to cost lives and livelihoods. https://t.co/BDoqIt321D

If testing asymptomatic people for COVID is supposedly not important than why is @realDonaldTrump testing everyone who has a chance of direct contact with him regardless of symptoms. The hypocrisy is truly unbelievable.

Striking that Mike Pence leader of the administration’s COVID Task Force gave his speech last night to a mostly mask-free closely crowded audience. This dangerous attitude and behavior sets a bad example for all. Wearing a mask is not a political statement just common sense!

Over 80000 Americans tragically have lost their lives to COVID-19 since the House passed the #HeroesAct 100 days ago.  Why does @senatemajldr Mitch McConnell continue to drag his feet to provide our families and communities the tools we need to fight this crisis?
Today is another great day to wear a mask — also a reminder that #COVID19 doesn’t take a break on the weekends. Thanks and stay safe this weekend! 😷 🇺🇸 https://t.co/ac5Oam9ohJ

Please join us live this Saturday August 15 at 3:30 PM Pacific for our latest Virtual Town Hall. I’ll be joined by my amazing friend and colleague @katieporteroc and we’ll be discussing the Climate Crisis COVID19 and much more. RSVP here: https://t.co/o8Q1KxB742.  Thank you! https://t.co/nX5lBL4TCF
Happy Saturday — today is another great day to wear a mask. Also just a reminder that #COVID19 doesn’t take the weekend off. Stay safe and #MaskUp 😷 🇺🇸 https://t.co/DGK34cRYH7

Why is it not a bigger story that Trump and the GOP included a $377 million West Wing remodel in their COVID relief proposal? People’s lives and livelihoods are at stake and this is what they’re fighting for? https://t.co/NAIGs8bMRc

We’ve gone months without a national testing strategy from the Trump Administration.  Here is the totally unacceptable result:  “U.S. testing for the coronavirus is dropping even as infections remain high and the death toll rises by more than 1000 a day” https://t.co/NAel2kE8kW
Happy Tuesday — like every other day we’re dealing with #COVID19 today has been another great day to wear a mask. 😷 🇺🇸 https://t.co/z5gXVcMzOD

Happy Monday — today is another great day to wear a mask.  It would also be a great day for Mitch McConnell to finally produce a #COVID19 proposal. We have stood ready to negotiate for more than two months but McConnell has decided to “take a pause.” 🇺🇸 😷 https://t.co/pN4eWvdcqv

That the Trump Administration would try to block billions for states to conduct testing and contact tracing in the upcoming coronavirus relief bill is outrageous.  Giving up isn’t a strategy. It’s simply not what we do as Americans.  Let’s follow the science and help our states.
Happy Sunday — another great day to wear a mask.  Off to Washington DC now to work on our 5th #COVID relief bill and much more. 🇺🇸 😷 https://t.co/fPQR42N4nf

Reminder that the Trump Administration wants to destroy the Affordable Care Act and open the door for insurers to treat #COVID19 as a pre-existing condition denying coverage to millions.   All while we’re in a pandemic that has already cost 122000 American lives.   Disgraceful.

Reminder that @HouseDemocrats passed a comprehensive #COVID19 relief bill over a month ago yet @SenateMajLdr Mitch McConnell has blocked it and offered no plan to help the American people.  His continued inaction will cost lives and livelihoods.  @nbcsandiego @DannyEFreeman https://t.co/Mp4yW0pTpI

Widespread testing for #COVID19 is not “overrated” — it is absolutely essential to get the American people back to work as safely as possible.  Also wearing a mask should have nothing to do with politics. It’s about respect for others and basic common sense.
The Vice President said yesterday that there isn’t a Coronavirus “second wave.”  I suppose that’s right because as Dr. Fauci said recently “we’re still in a first wave.” https://t.co/DetkKEd6S9

Reminder that @HouseDemocrats passed a comprehensive #COVID19 relief bill a month ago yet @SenateMajLdr McConnell has left it sitting on his desk with no new plan to help the American people.   McConnell’s continued inaction will cost lives and livelihoods.   Let’s get it done!

Over 109000 Americans are tragically dead of #COVID19.  Over 21 million are still out of work.  Many state and local budgets are collapsing.  Now isn’t the time to declare “Mission Accomplished” or take a pause.  We need continued action to support the American people.
TUNE IN LIVE: Rep. Mike Levin Virtual Town Hall on the #Coronavirus. Email townhallquestions@Mikelevin.org https://t.co/jQUy2gUcgn

I’m honored to help lead the House effort to get our veterans back to work in the wake of #COVID19. Our bipartisan bill on veteran education and job training benefits was announced earlier today. https://t.co/pDsrWZNfio

Every day we see the need for further action to combat the #COVID19 crisis:   Over 107000 dead.  Nearly 1.9M cases.  42.6M unemployment claims in the past 11 weeks.  Mitch McConnell it’s past time to act on the relief bill we sent you.  @senatemajldr what are you waiting for?

40M+ Americans have lost their jobs due to #COVID19. I’ve spoken with so many who have lost their jobs can't pay their rent and also with veterans and seniors who are worried about where they are going to get their next meal — our nation is in crisis. On multiple levels. (7/8)

Reminder that while the nation battles the #COVID19 pandemic the Trump Administration is *still* trying to destroy the Affordable Care Act — and health care protections for those with pre-existing conditions.

I thank everyone in North County San Diego and South OC for peacefully shining a spotlight on racial injustice over the weekend. Let’s move forward with compassion as we confront racial inequality the #COVID19 pandemic and our financial crisis. We are all in this together.

I was pleased to be on with several of my CA House colleagues tonight for a bipartisan discussion on #COVID19. Much more from Congress is needed to address both our public health and economic crises. Let’s work together and get it done! @fox5sandiego #CA49 https://t.co/rS3ljZmSlw

I’m deeply honored to pay tribute this #MemorialDay to the sacrifices of those Americans that have laid down their lives in service to this great nation.  As we respond to COVID-19 this weekend looks a little different than normal but Memorial Day must never lose its meaning. https://t.co/lYhwTyIBka

We must never deny coverage for those with pre-existing conditions including anyone who has tested positive for #COVID19. We must protect the Affordable Care Act!

While state and local governments face fiscal disaster and tens of millions need help Mitch McConnell wants to take a pause.  This is not a time to take a pause @senatemajldr.  COVID-19 isn’t taking a pause.  The economic crisis isn’t taking a pause.  You shouldn’t either. https://t.co/hixfuRErjm

Mitch McConnell said we should let local governments go bankrupt.  Then he said we should pause.   But COVID isn’t taking a pause.  I don’t expect him to agree with every word of what we just passed in the House.    But he must act NOW so a bipartisan compromise can be reached.
As part of our next #COVID19 bill we must support additional federal funding for childcare! @fox5sandiego @JoeKhalilTV https://t.co/A6JRJTe62q

Very pleased we passed the $484B #COVID19 interim relief bill today but so much work remains. Let’s get it done!  ✅ Money to secure elections  ✅ Protection for frontline workers  ✅ Stability for the US Postal Service  ✅ Jobs program to get millions of Americans back to work

Just arrived in Washington DC to vote later today on the $484B interim #COVID19 relief bill.  I’m here for the small businesses in #CA49 who still haven’t received a dime and the frontline medical workers struggling to help their patients.  We are all in this together. https://t.co/zMy1N4Nngx

Leaving soon on the red eye for Washington DC to vote on the $484 billion #COVID19 relief bill in the morning. More help for small businesses hospitals and a national testing strategy is on the way. Also thanks to my friend Louise for making me the cool patriotic mask. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/5pwxDtR2w8

As we celebrate #EarthDay during #COVID19 let’s remember the importance of FOLLOWING THE SCIENCE when creating public policy.   Embracing science we will confront the climate crisis with the seriousness it demands while creating the jobs of the future.  https://t.co/JoYfdGSce9

While today’s interim bill was a positive step we must fight for the next #COVID19 relief bill to include:  ✅ Money to secure elections  ✅ Protection for frontline workers  ✅ Stability for the US Postal Service  ✅ A jobs program to get millions of Americans back to work

Very pleased we’ve agreed on another bipartisan #COVID19 relief package that provides more support for the lives and livelihoods of the American people. It’s vastly improved over the initial proposal from Mitch McConnell. I’ll be flying to DC tomorrow. https://t.co/oLDkWZLKo0

I’m planning to fly to Washington DC tomorrow to help pass additional #COVID19 relief that should include another $300 billion for small businesses $75 billion for hospitals and more. Let’s get this done! @fox5sandiego https://t.co/pZ3YvnvJpX

And on Friday I led a letter that was signed by 72 members urging HHS to support health care providers who have high Medicaid volumes such as community health centers in the next distribution of COVID-19 relief funds. (5/6)

On Thursday the @latimes wrote a story called “Trump plan for coronavirus supplies yields payoff for favored companies” which followed a letter I led with 56 of my colleagues about a secretive Trump administration project run through FEMA. (4/6) https://t.co/OSuecCKunS

On Tuesday I was very pleased to announce that our local colleges and universities in #CA49 will receive $44 million in #COVID19 relief funding. These funds follow a letter I wrote to Secretary Betsy DeVos calling on her to deliver this funding as quickly as possible. (3/6) https://t.co/jsKVEJzcLh

I’ve cosponsored the Coronavirus Community Relief Act which would set up a local stabilization fund for cities with fewer than 500000 people. I spoke with nearly all of the mayors in #CA49 this past week and many of our cities have taken a huge financial hit. (2/6)
This past week I’ve been fighting for immediate additional #COVID19 funding for small businesses hospitals state & local governments and more: (1/6)

Six weeks ago the House passed its first bipartisan bill to empower the administration to produce and distribute national #COVID19 testing.    Six weeks later we still don’t have adequate testing.  We can’t have a healthy economy without healthy people.

It’s more important than ever that we all complete the Census.  It’s just a few questions per person and responses determine how the federal government spends billions in funding.  That money includes hospitals and other things that are critical as we fight the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/x4M3niJ8mv

Thanks to Good Morning San Diego for having me on earlier to discuss how the recent coronavirus relief bill can help San Diegans who are struggling. I hope everyone stays healthy and safe during this difficult time. @KUSINews https://t.co/nzOqmjDWQE

The next coronavirus relief bill should include a reinstatement of the full State and Local Tax (SALT) deduction. Capping the deduction has placed a large burden on residents of #CA49. The House already passed legislation to repeal the SALT cap last December. Let’s get this done!

We can beat #COVID19 if we work together and stick together.  For more resources and archives of our weekly virtual town hall meetings on the coronavirus please visit our website at https://t.co/Pf18hmW25V  Let’s #FlattenTheCurve! https://t.co/WWvCSVOx40
